attributes.action: Call a halt to a proposed development to build multi storey flats in the middle of ancient woodland and local nature reserve
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: If this development goes ahead it will fragment the woodlands, sever a wildlife corridor and devastate this biodiverse and sensitive habitat. Robsack Wood and Churchwood are inventoried as ancient woodland - 40 metres of ancient woodland are included within the development site. This area is an important public amenity in   St. Leonards on Sea East Sussex. It is imperative that this development is stopped.

rejection.details: Under planning legislation, the granting of planning permission is the responsibility of the elected local authority. Local authorities must determine planning applications in accordance with the development plan for the area unless material considerations indicate otherwise. Unless the appeal process is invoked, the local planning authority’s decision is final. The Government cannot express a view on an individual planning application, because of the Secretary of State’s appellate role in the planning system.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
